version_description:
- Fixed sun & moon ring not displaying correctly in some geographical regions
- Fixed moon phase not displaying correctly in some geographical regions on Apple Watch
- When 24 hour time mode is enabled on your watch, ring 6AM/6PM labels now change to 6/18
- Removed time position from Apple Watch app

Improvements:

- Real iPad support (not just a blown up iPhone app)
- Support WatchOS 3: rise/set times computed on watch
- Added more options for alert time offsets
- Added help (a FAQ)
- Now allows location "only when in use" mode (existing app installs can change via Settings)
- When the phone app, today extension, or watch app are running they no longer keep updating location. They refresh location on display, but that is it.
- Location "always" mode is now only requested when you enable an alert. Why is "always" mode requested? Sundial works best when it can get your up-to-date location if you travel far enough to change solar/lunar times. But this is optional and if not enabled, the last cached location is used when scheduling alerts in the background.
- Location "always" mode now uses geofencing to be notified of a location move greater than 5 miles or 8 kilometers from last location. This may result in even less battery usage (which is already <1%). This means that if no other apps are using full location always mode, the location indicator in the status bar will be outlined instead of solid.
- Decreased install size

Fixes:

- Resolved UI glitches on iOS 10
- Fixed bug where you might not receive all alerts if you defined more than 4 alerts
- Now support far north/south locations that may have 24 hours of sunlight or darkness for certain periods of the year
- Fixed UI glitches if bold text or large text enabled

- Added Apple Watch complications: text summary of nearest event or mini version of solar and lunar transit arcs
- You can customize the sound for an alert notification, globally or for a particular alert. Includes several short sounds and longer 30 second sounds.
- Added two new event types: solar mid-morning and solar mid-afternoon
- Fixed issue where app could not calculate sunset if the time of sunset was close to midnight GMT
- Grammar fixes

- Improved precision of sunrise and sunset times
- Improved computation of solar duration, solar noon, and moon peak time around daylight savings time
- Now detect changes to timezone faster, such as landing in new city
Support iPhone X

- Support new iPhone XS, XS Max, and XR
- Support new Series 4 watches

- Fixed Apple Watch Series 4 crash (if one of your watch faces used a mixed text/dial complication).
- New Series 4 Infograph Apple Watch complications
- Added time indicator to existing Apple Watch complications

- Fixed bug where, after disabling all alerts, you would continue to receive notifications for the last alert previously enabled ("zombie alert")
- For lunar alerts such as full moon, support sunrise as a 'When to Notify' option
- Show 90 days worth of alerts when ‘View Upcoming Alerts’ is selected
- Fully support the new 11” and 12.9” iPad Pros

- The time to the last solar event (sunrise, solar noon, or sunset) is now called out only 1 hour after it occurred. After 1 hour, Sundial will start counting down to the next solar event.
- Added six new events you can create alerts for: start of astronomical twilight, start of nautical twilight, end of astronomical twilight, end of nautical twilight, solar midnight, and lunar midnight
- Refer to dawn/dusk more strictly as Start of Civil Twilight and End of Civil Twilight: that was their intention previously (the alert is based on when the sun reaches 6 degrees below horizon in morning or evening)
- New Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
Support watchOS version 3 and 4 again (apologies for the disruption)

Rise/mid/set dots on the sun and moon arcs are easier to see now: they float above the time dial

Apple Watch improvements:
- Added moon rise/peak/set dots to Infograph complications
- Added lunar illumination percentage to Infograph complications and the watch app
- Complications more up-to-date
- And more!

Fixed: moon was missing from iPhone Today Widget.

Previous:
Rise/mid/set dots on the sun and moon arcs are easier to see now: they float above the time dial
Apple Watch improvements:
- Added moon rise/peak/set dots to Infograph complications
- Added lunar illumination percentage to Infograph complications and the watch app
- Complications more up-to-date
- And more!

- The time to the last solar event (sunrise, solar noon, or sunset) is now called out only 1 hour after it occurred. After 1 hour, Sundial will start counting down to the next solar event.
- Added six new events you can create alerts for: start of astronomical twilight, start of nautical twilight, end of astronomical twilight, end of nautical twilight, solar midnight, and lunar midnight
- Refer to dawn/dusk more strictly as Start of Civil Twilight and End of Civil Twilight: that was their intention previously (the alert is based on when the sun reaches 6 degrees below horizon in morning or evening)
- New Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

- The solar and lunar dials now appear in the Today Widget on iPhone 6 and higher and all iPads (iOS10 and later)
- Now support moon phase alerts for new moon, first quarter moon, full moon, and last quarter moon. You can choose the alert to be sent at the precise time the moon phase occurs, or be notified at the time of the moonrise, sunset, or end of civil/nautical/astronomical twilight before the phase change.
- This fixes reliability issues with the previous "Full Moon Rise" alert. Any existing "Full Moon Rise" alerts will be transitioned to the new system.
- You can now review what iOS notifications you will receive based on your current alert definitions. Just touch the ‘New Upcoming Alerts’ button at the top of the Alerts screen
- For moon phase alerts, offsets up to +- 28 days are now supported
- For all other alerts, you can now create an offset up to +- 23 hours, 45 minutes

- Fixed bug where, after disabling all alerts, you would continue to receive notifications for the last alert previously enabled ("zombie alert")
- For lunar alerts such as full moon, support sunrise as a 'When to Notify' option
- Show 90 days worth of alerts when ‘View Upcoming Alerts’ is selected
- Fully support the new 11” and 12.9” iPad Pros

Time travel: view solar and lunar times for another calendar day
- iOS: use gestures to move forward/back one day at a time; long press to fast travel; use the calendar button to jump to a specific date
- Apple Watch: turn the digital crown to move by day; force touch to jump to a specific day or, on Series 4, to start fast travel; force touch again to go back to today

Other improvements:
- Option to show civil, nautical, and astronomical twilight on the sundial (enabled by default)
- The moon’s tilt for your time and position is taken into account when displaying moon phase
- Full voice over support (vision accessibility)

Watch improvements
- Show daylight length
- Show +1 when a time is for tomorrow (such as tomorrow’s sunrise time)

iPhone/iPad improvements:
- Show dawn/dusk and full/new moon information on the main screen (can be collapsed on iPhone)
- Upcoming alerts are shown on the main screen: swipe up to see more
- Improved alert editing: alerts are automatically grouped and sorted based on type and offset; you can select multiple alerts to delete or duplicate
- Improved workflow for creating a new alert: Sundial immediately shows the event selector
- Improved large preview of upcoming alerts

In-app purchase to unlock the following new features:
- Alert offsets can be tuned to the minute
- Option to synchronize alert definitions between devices using iCloud
- Option to turn off screen lock when Sundial is active

Premium unlock is also required to create more than 1 alert; existing users can continue to edit any existing alerts above this limit

Fixed: was not always refreshing location when the watch entered foreground

Fixed: was not always refreshing location when the watch entered foreground

- Tweaked how long to show today's sunrise/lunar noon/sunset times
- A few more iPad 4 improvements
More reliable background alert rescheduling when location changes

- Apple Watch improvements:
* The second screen has been broken out into separate solar and lunar screens, with more information including dawn and dusk times
* The Watch app no longer tries to get it's location from the iPhone (this could cause issues when the phone's location was less up-to-date than the watch location)
* The Watch app now has a screen to review what location is being used
* Fix layout issue in watchOS 6

- Support custom locations (premium only)
* Search by place name, any portion of an address, or geographic coordinates.
* Save a location to favorites.
* Optionally mirror the custom location to alert preview, alert notifications, today widget, and/or Apple Watch. By default, the custom location is only used to customize the display of solar/lunar times and preview of upcoming notifications (with real device notifications continuing to use your GPS location)
* Optionally sync/backup favorites and recents to iCloud.
* So that free users can kick the tires on this feature before deciding if they want to upgrade to Premium, a number of selectable points of interests (POIs) are bundled with Sundial. The POIs can be hidden.

- You can configure whether to show location information on the iPhone/iPad main screen. By default, location info is only displayed when a searched or favorite location is displayed. You can select to always show location details in location settings (premium only).

- Your current location is now used to determine your timezone when displaying solar/lunar times and scheduling alerts. This can be optionally changed back to using the phone’s current timezone instead (premium only).

- You can configure Sundial to track your location while the iPhone/iPad app is open (premium only). By default, Sundial only updates your location when you open Sundial or open a location screen. Sundial continues to use low-power geo-fencing to get notification of updates when it is in the background so it can update notifications as you travel across the city or farther.

- Simpler twilight labels used, such as civil dawn and astronomical dusk, in both alert event selection and notification text

- Time travel is now limited to 7 days from today for the free version

- iOS 11 and watchOS 4.2 and above are now required

Apple Watch:
- Fixed: digital crown on location page was doing time travel instead of scrolling through location information
- Optimized location requests
- Improved complication updates

Fixed: today widget on iPadOS 13 could be clipped

Note: dark mode will be supported in the Today Widget in a future release

- Improved tinted complications for Apple Watch Series 4 & 5 on watchOS 6
- Support iOS 13 dark mode in the app and Today Widget
- Large font sizes are better supported in the alerts, locations, and settings screens.
- Fixed alert preview glitches when first launching Sundial
- Miscellaneous bug fixes

- Fixed: coordinates in DMS mode could show "Invalid" in certain geographical regions
- Fixed: Sundial crashed on new 10.2” iPad
- Moon illumination percentage is now reported to one decimal place (99.8% or 99,8%) in most places
- The FULL/NEW moon labels count down within 24 hours of the full/new moon time
- New alert sounds for Premium users: owl, crickets, birds, frogs, tide/surf, and more
- Alert preview layout improved when "bold text" accessibility setting is enabled
- When time traveling on Apple Watch, the days offset is now reported below the date (e.g. +7 days)
- Show scrollbars in more places

- In Location Settings, you can now select to show times for your current location in the GMT/UTC timezone always (premium only)
- There is no longer a separate Apple Watch 'Use GPS To Determine Time Zone' setting; the selection on Sundial iPhone app 'Time Zone for Current Location' will be used on the Apple Watch app automatically
- New Dial options in Settings: show additional hour numerals and tweak nitpicky details like rotation of numerals
- Twilights show/hide has moved to the new Dial settings screen
- Many voice over improvements
- Small change to date formatting to match culture
- Fixed: Sundial crashed on launch when the language was Thai
- Fixed: lunar phase alerts that had 'When to Notify' set to Moonrise, Sunrise, Sunset, etc. *before* the phase could fire the alert a day early. For example, an alert such as "Sunrise before the new moon"

- Fixed rare dials rendering issue
- Added occasional Sundial Premium reminder for free users (in lieu of advertising)
Significantly reduce the frequency of Sundial Premium reminders
Future proofing: more gracefully handle iCloud updates from newer versions of Sundial

New equinox and solstice alert types; these are automatically added (but not enabled) to your alert list.

On iPhone, touch the expand button in the middle of the screen to show additional data:

- Day and night completion percentage. By default this is defined as sunset to sunrise. This can be changed in settings to be dusk to dawn. This setting also affects the existing daylength value.
- Lunar phase name.
- Solar/lunar altitude and azimuth.

On Today Widget, the level of detail in expanded mode can be tweaked in Settings.
On iPad these are always shown when premium is unlocked.
On Apple Watch, most of this information is available in a new page when Premium is unlocked.

The sun images now fade around dawn/dusk.

Time travel now keeps the time sticky so that day/night %, moon illumination %, and sun/moon position is reported on for the current time as you time travel.

Fixed: the Apple Watch app would frequently restart after being closed if you also had a Sundial complication on your watch face. This could also cause complication update issues in certain cases.

Fixed: the sunlight dials might not be displayed if there was no dawn or dusk in a day.
Fixed crash when adding new alert on iPad
Unfortunately, I have had to discontinue the Apple Watch app. Please see What's New in the iPhone app (under Settings) for an explanation or visit http://sundialapp.com/watch.html.

- Fix some iOS14 Today Widget layout issues
- Improve date selector on iOS14
- Add support for iPad Air 4th generation (2020 model)
Fix for rare crash
